page.title: 15Gardening in Hayle
page.content: The{flowers}which grow best in this area are lime loving ones like Snapdragon (Antirrhinum),Nasturtiums, Lupins and wild Cowslips. In summer the{salty atmosphere}keeps the air damp and levels the temperature so plants grow well. In winter it keeps the frost away so that tender plants can be grown. High winds and soil containing salt burns the leaves of plants. In winter crops such as sugar beet like a high salt level in the soil. Mainly hardy types of{trees and {shrubs}grow well. Some of the more unusual ones are Mimosa, Eucalyptus, Senecios and Hebes. The Hebes are a family of shrubs from New Zealand and are too tender to grow well away from the coast. They are all evergreen and range in size from a few centimetres to three metres or more.
